info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 6:31PM EDT until June 14 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Leon and Wakulla.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Crawfordville, Leon Sinks, Bethel, Hilliardville, Eight Mile Pond, Wakulla Springs, Lake Munson, Vereen, Arran, Gaither Community Center, North Florida Fairgrounds, Gene Cox Stadium, Jack McLean Park, Apalachee Ridge Estates, Southwood, J R Alford Greenway, Apalachee Regional Park and Chaires Crossroads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING
